name: 2012_10_humanities_student_major_207_rit
title: 2012-10-humanities-student-major_207_rit.txt
content_scrubbed:
There[.] a separate shuttle specifically for these events. Here[.] all the text from the email:

####

Accompanying the bus this week will be Professors Dave Sluberski and Jack Beck from the School of Film & Animation!  J
 
If this your first "First Friday", here are the rules. 
·         Ccomplete the two attached forms (we'll have extras if you forget) and bring them with you on Friday!!! 

·         Board the big yellow school bus at Carlson Loop (Near F lot, behind building 7), and travel with us to the following locations.

·         We do not take reservations.  **Line-up begins at 5:45pm**!

·         By attending this event, you are representing RIT.  Some galleries will have food and/or beverages out for guests.  You are a guest and should feel free to sample – but remember, this is not dinner.  J

·         Some locations may have wine out for patrons. Students should NOT be helping themselves to this.  If students under 21 consume wine at an event, they will be banned from future trips and reported to Student Conduct.

·         It[.] important to have a "time-keeping device" with you so you don't miss the bus when boarding between locations.  Wrist-watch, cell phone, etc.

·         Cell phones must be set on vibrate or "no ring" in galleries.

·         Have fun!

 
 

First Friday Bus Schedule

For Friday, October 5, 2012

 

6:00                       Begin boarding bus, Carlson Bus Loop

(top of F-Lot; no reservation: first come, first boarded!)

 

6:15                       Depart RIT 

 

6:30-9:30            Gallery stops

 

~9:30                    Depart for RIT

 

 

 

Hungerford Urban Artisans (HUA) (6:30-7:15)

1115 East Main St. (at N. Goodman)

Open Studio

Wedge Media #208, Francesca DeCaire #216, Airigami #234, Constance Mauro #236, Mark Whitney #308, Rochester Woman Magazine #311, The Group in the Loop #354, Jeanne Beck #366, Hodaka Hasebe #422, Suzi Zefting-Kuhn #458, Rochester Art Club #437

 
Anderson Arts Building, BookSmart & Village Gate (7:30-9:00)
250 N. Goodman St.
Rochester, NY 14607
(585) 737-2627

Walk This Way – HIGHLIGHT!!!

Come celebrate the opening of Art Walk in the Neighborhood of the Arts. Open studios: great art in many different media including: jewelry,fabric, music and something for everyone. Come, meet the artists and join the celebration. 5 PM - 9 PM  (There will be special events going on outside of Village Gate, and some restaurants will be offering tastings.)

 
Spot Coffee (9:10-9:45)
200 East Ave.
Rochester, NY 14604
(585) 613-4600

Identity Theft by Andrew Hallinan

Andrew Hallinan is currently receiving his degree in Photographic Illustration at Rochester Institute of Technology. Identity Theft uses composited images to push the boundaries of what a portrait really is.
